intro: Niphobolus adnascens, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its thorny calyx is a distinctive feature. Niphobolus adnascens is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
